item.title: Basic setup of a UIViewController in UIKit
item.description: View Controllers in UIKit can best be described as containing one screen worth of information. Data, functions, UI - whatever the screen needs to be complete. When we create a new view controller it contains the following minimal code to get the screen up and running, and allows us to easily customize our screen how we want it from there. class ViewController: UIViewController { override func viewDidLoad() { super.viewDidLoad() // Do any additional setup after loading the view.
